Material used.Description: α-synuclein A53T and wild-type constructs were transfected into HEK293 cells.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased α-synuclein aggregation and reduced clearance in A53T-expressing cells.
LRRK2 G2019S showed 3-fold higher kinase activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control for aggregation assays.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test with p < 0.05 as significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Aggregation levels < 20% of wild-type, kinase activity within 1.5x wild-type range.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Aggregation levels ≥ 30% of wild-type, kinase activity ≥ 2x wild-type.

Material used.Description: Transgenic flies expressing human LRRK2 G2019S were used for behavioral and neuropathological analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Flies with LRRK2 G2019S exhibited 50% shorter lifespan and severe locomotor deficits.

Biological replicates.Description: Five independent fly lines were tested for each genotype.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type flies were used as controls for lifespan and behavior.

Basic negative control.Description: Flies without transgene expression served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Kaplan-Meier survival analysis with log-rank test.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lifespan < 40 days, locomotor score < 50% of wild-type.
